title: Portzilla
shortDescription: Move HTTP traffic around your domain with ease
longDescription:
Portzilla makes it easy to move HTTP traffic around your domain. [Check out the demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page).

```bash
torrent.yoursite.com ‚ü∂ 172.132.921:8787 [Port Proxy] 
 yoursite.com/api ‚ü∂ your-api.now.sh [Location Proxy] 
 yoursite.com/docs ‚ü∂ docs.yoursite.com [301 Redirect]
```

*Seamlessly move traffic from any subdomain or path to other parts of your domain.*

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page). 

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to other services on your domain
* Supports proxying to ports and urls, as well as redirects.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.

Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.

Visit [portzilla.networkchimp.com](https://portzilla.networkchimp.com) to upgrade to an unlimited plan.
author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic from any URL to another port on your domain
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Use subdomains in your route.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

products.title: Pro
products.longDescription: Proxy traffic on unlimited routes with the Pro tier.

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic from any URL to another port on your domain
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Use subdomains in your route.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic from any URL to other services on your domain
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Use subdomains in your route.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic from a URL to any service on your domain
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Use subdomains in your route.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

versions.releaseNotes:
Version 1.5.2 Updates:
* Host header is forwarded on Target Resources requests
* Fixed bug where Custom Headers were set as Response instead of Request headers.

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic to any service on a domain without using NGINX
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Use subdomains in your route.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic to any service on a domain without using NGINX
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Use subdomains in your route.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic to any service on your domain without NGINX
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

Or your API on port `3000`,

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/api/ping ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:3000/ping
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Supports routing from any root or subdomain.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc. (WordPress support coming soon).
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic to any service on your domain without NGINX
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

Or your API on port `3000`,

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/api/ping ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:3000/ping
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Supports routing from any root or subdomain.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc. (WordPress support coming soon).
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.
* Debug mode to help with unresponsive services.

Read Portzilla‚Äôs [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Proxy traffic to any service on your domain without NGINX
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Proxy traffic from any URL on your domain to a service listening on another port. You can even send custom headers along with each request.  Try it out for free.**

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page) 

Say your hosting your docs on a server listening on port `4080`, Portzilla can proxy traffic from `docs.yoursite.com` or `www.yoursite.com/docs` to your server.

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/docs ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:4080
```

Or your API on port `3000`,

```bash
curl https://www.yoursite.com/api/ping ‚Üí https://yoursite.com:3000/ping
```

You would normally need NGINX or another reverse-proxy for this, but you can just use Portzilla now.

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to another service on your domain for *free*.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page) or read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

products.longDescription: Proxy traffic on unlimited routes with the Pro tier.

* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to other services on the internet

* Optionally cache incoming requests.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.

gettingStarted101.helpvalue: üëÄ Check out the tutorials for step-by-step installation instructions.

gettingStarted2.helpvalue: üî• Portzilla can proxy traffic from any URL (including subdomains) to another service running on the same domain. Simply map the Route URL to the Target Port.

gettingStarted3.helpvalue: üî• Route URLs must include a hostname to resolve correctly.

gettingStarted7.helpvalue: üî• Custom Headers will be sent with each request to the service listening on Target Port.

gettingStarted8.helpvalue: üî• You can add a Custom Error Page that will render if your service isn't responding. Portzilla will show a default error page if you don't add one.

gettingStarted9.helpvalue: üî• Routes can be reordered in the UI below for organization but this won't have any other effect on Portzilla.

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Send incoming HTTP traffic to other services on your domain
proposedApp.longDescription:
** Portzilla is a network-level reverse proxy for sending incoming traffic to other services on the internet**

```bash
torrent.yoursite.com ‚ü∂ 172.132.921:8787
yoursite.com/api ‚ü∂ ec2-103.compute.amazonaws.com
```

*Seamlessly move HTTP traffic from one place to another in a feature-rich, easy to use interface*

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page). 

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to other services on the internet
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.

Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.

Visit [portzilla.networkchimp.com](https://portzilla.networkchimp.com) to upgrade to an unlimited plan.

Portzilla makes it easy to move HTTP traffic around your domain. [Check out the demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page).

```bash
torrent.yoursite.com ‚ü∂ 172.132.921:8787 [Port Proxy]

```

*Seamlessly move traffic from any subdomain or path to other parts of your domain.*

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page).

* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to other services on your domain
* Supports proxying to ports and urls, as well as redirects.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.

Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.

Visit [portzilla.networkchimp.com](https://portzilla.networkchimp.com) to upgrade to an unlimited plan.

gettingStarted10.helpvalue: üìñ Read the docs for more information.

gettingStarted101.helpvalue: üëÄ Check out the tutorials for step-by-step installation instructions.

gettingStarted2.helpvalue: üî• Portzilla can proxy traffic from any URL (including subdomains) to another service running on the same domain. Simply map the Route URL to the Target Port.

gettingStarted3.helpvalue: üî• Route URLs must include a hostname to resolve correctly.

gettingStarted7.helpvalue: üî• Custom Headers will be sent with each request to the service listening on Target Port.

gettingStarted8.helpvalue: üî• You can add a Custom Error Page that will render if your service isn't responding. Portzilla will show a default error page if you don't add one.

gettingStarted9.helpvalue: üî• Routes can be reordered in the UI below for organization but this won't have any other effect on Portzilla.

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Send incoming HTTP traffic to other services on your domain
proposedApp.longDescription:
** Portzilla is a network-level reverse proxy for sending incoming traffic to other services on your domain**

```bash
torrent.yoursite.com ‚ü∂ 172.132.921:8787
yoursite.com/api ‚ü∂ ec2-24.amazonaws.com:4080
```

*Seamlessly move HTTP traffic from one place to another in a feature-rich, easy to use interface*

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page). 

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to another service on your domain.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.
* Custom error templates for unresponsive services.

Visit [portzilla.networkchimp.com](https://portzilla.networkchimp.com) to upgrade to an unlimited plan or read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.

proposedApp.title: Portzilla
proposedApp.shortDescription: Move HTTP traffic around your domain with ease
proposedApp.longDescription:
Portzilla makes it easy to move HTTP traffic around your domain. [Check out the demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page).

```bash
torrent.yoursite.com ‚ü∂ 172.132.921:8787 [Port Proxy] 
 yoursite.com/api ‚ü∂ your-api.now.sh [Location Proxy] 
 yoursite.com/docs ‚ü∂ docs.yoursite.com [301 Redirect]
```

*Seamlessly move traffic from any subdomain or path to other parts of your domain.*

Check out [Portzilla in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/portzilla-api.html?ref=app-page). 

Portzilla Features:
* Forward traffic on any route (including subdomains) to other services on your domain
* Supports proxying to ports and urls, as well as redirects.
* Supports SPA's like React, Vue, etc.
* Optionally cache incoming requests.

Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/portzilla.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.

Visit [portzilla.networkchimp.com](https://portzilla.networkchimp.com) to upgrade to an unlimited plan.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp
